intro: Lindelofia anchusoides subsp. anchusoides, commonly known as the anchusoides lindelofia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens for its hardy nature and visual interest.
